Dear Alisa Marie Otto:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 10/7/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (d) Three references obtained from
persons who are unrelated to the staff
person.
Seven of Fourteen staff files reviewed did not contain documentation that all three
of the references required to be obtained prior to hire were completed timely.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (e) A record of any convictions other than
minor traffic violations from either of the
following:
• (i) The Michigan state police, tribal
police, or the equivalent state or
Canadian provincial law
enforcement agency where the
person usually resides.

Three of Fourteen staff files reviewed did not contain documentation of criminal
history checks completed prior to hire, all of which were reportedly completed
timely, but lost when the agency switched to a new SharePoint.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (h) Documentation from the department
that the person has not been named in a
central registry case as the perpetrator of
child abuse or neglect in Michigan or in
any state where the person lived in the 5
years preceding hire.
Three of Fourteen staff files reviewed did not contain documentation of central
registry check completed prior to hire, two of which were reportedly completed
timely, but lost when the agency switched to a new SharePoint and one of which
has not yet been received.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Creating a form for obtaining phone references would document the date and
information obtained.
• Ensure job descriptions are placed within the personnel file prior to hire.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• References should be obtained from individuals outside of the agency.
• Ensure social service workers and supervisor receive all training on required
topics prior to the next inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment was reviewed. No concerns were identified
and there was no need for corrective action plan development as the agency has
only completed three foster home transfers.
Financial Overview
A financial audit has not yet been completed as the agency has not yet been open
a full year. A budget was provided and reviewed. No concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The staff interviewed reported the agency is in the process of recruiting foster
families and there have been no concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space and equipment to provide for the delivery of
foster home certification services. No physical files are stored onsite as all files are
maintained electronically, and no physical CHRI has been received by the agency.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
N/A
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
